page.title: 20People and Rolvenden Pride
page.content: Many people in Rolvenden are proud of their village and work hard to keep it a good place to live. The local policeman, although he now travels over a larger area, helps people sort out their problems as well as arresting others for crimes. The Member of Parliament for Ashford lives in Rolvenden and he makes sure his constituents' interests are well-represented in Parliament. Parish Councillors meet regularly to discuss all matters of village interest. This year people in Rolvenden have an extra reason to be proud of their village. In a competition organised by the Kent Voluntary Service Council, Rolvenden was judged the overall winner of the{Best Kept Village in {Kent.}THE CHILDREN OF ROLVENDEN C.P. SCHOOL ARE PROUD TO BE A PART OF THEIR VILLAGE AND THE BBC DOMESDAY PROJECT.
